newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romanian cen.bank gives up computing leu rates.
newsitem.headline: Romanian cen.bank gives up computing leu rates.

text.p: Romania's central bank (BNR) said on Wednesday it would no longer compute the reference rate for the local leu currency in the latest of a series of moves to liberalise the foreign exchange market.
"The new reality on the foreign exchange market was behind the BNR's decision to give up computing the reference rate," a BNR statement said.

The reference rate, computed since August 1994 when the BNR introduced a free-floating foreign exchange market, was a weighted average based on daily reports of market operators. It was a guidance rate used for statistical accounting purposes.
